place.name: EBRINGTON
place.gazetteerText: EBRINGTON, or Ebberton, a parish in the district of Shipston-on-Stour and county of Gloucester; adjacent to Warwickshire and to the West Midland railway, 2 miles East of Chipping-Campden. It contains the hamlet of Hidcote-Boyce; and gives the title of Viscount to Earl Fortescue. Post town, Chipping-Campden, under Moreton-in-the-Marsh. Acres, 2, 960. Real property, £3, 873. Pop., 570. Houses, 123. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage, annexed to the vicarage of Mickleton, in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. The church contains monuments of the Fortescues; and is good. There are a national school and some charities. . (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
